title.narrative: Syrien-Irak 2019-2021. US Department of State (DoS), Access to Water in Northeast Syria.

description.narrative: The main objective is to improve access to drinking water in areas of Hasakah and Deir Ezzor provinces outside of the Syrian regime’s control. Moreover, by building the capacity of governing entities and reinvigorating citizen voices, the project will support the emergence of a new social compact in target communities. The resulting trust and buy-in will bolster the social compact via inclusive service provision as it builds resilience, equipping individuals and communities to resist disinformation and extremism as they see their lives improve and hold governing entities accountable now and in any future political transition as the context evolves. Civil society will be strengthened as a secondary effect as it gains skills in implementing local council-led essential service activities.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
